text:
Hi Guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show you
how to make homemade French fries.

So many of you have been asking for this and
I kind of been debating making this recipe

because I mean it is kind of is a recipe but
not really, it's more like a method that I

am showing you, which is kind of like what
I think is the perfect way to make French

fries to get them to that crispiness on the
outside and like fluffiness on the inside.

Now, the ingredients that you are going to
need are two, you are going to need potatoes
and oil to fry them in.

I am using vegetable oil which I have here
coming up to temperature to 310 degrees Fahrenheit.

As for the potatoes, I am just using russet
potatoes that I have peeled and these are

really big ones that I cut into like fries
shape.

You can use a mandolin for this, you can use
and actual French fry cutter.

I just used a knife because I don't have any
fancy equipment like that.

Now what I have got here is my French fries,
my potatoes I have them soaking in cold water

and I have had them in here for about a half
an hour.

What that does, you can see the water is not
very clear, it's kind of foggy, because it
is releasing it's starch.

Now, the more starch the potato releases in
the water, the crispier the potatoes are going
to be when you fry them up.
So!

I have had these in here for about a half
an hour and I am going to take those out and

I am going to put them on a single layer on
a baking sheet because it is absolutely crucial

that you dry your potatoes completely before
frying them otherwise it can be such a hazard

and you can get really hurt because the water
will bubble up everywhere and that would be
really really bad.

So just take a minute to lay them nice and
flat and I am just going to take a kitchen
towel.
I've got one right over here.

I am going to take a couple of minutes to
make sure they are really nicely patted dry.
Let's see.
Ya!
These look great!

Now what we are going to do is we are going
to double cook the French fries.

We are going to cook them twice at two different
temperature because they are going to -.that
method is going to serve two different purposes.

The first time we cook them which is going
to be now, they are going to be a low temperature,
about 310 degrees Fahrenheit.

I am doing that because I want to cook these
on the inside.

They are not going to be crispy, they are
not going to be a golden brown all over, but

they are going to be, just going to do half
at a time, as you can see it is not sizzling

and that's fine - oops stuck - but they are
going to ensure that the middle are cooked
all the way through.

So I am going to let those cook for about
8 minutes or so and then I am going to take

them out and put them on a paper towel again
just to drain the excess oil, then do the
second batch and then we will change the temperature.

Now, my potatoes cooked for about 8 minutes
at 310 degrees.
Now I have taken them out 7 to 8 minutes.

I have taken them out and you can see they
are lightly colored, but look, very, very,
very soft.

But if you take a knife, pierce it through,
it pierces right out, it is perfectly cooked
all the way through, which is what we want.

Now what I did was turn the heat up quite
a bit and I got my oil up to about 380.
You want it really really nice and hot.

Just like we did the first time, I am going
to do this in two batches.

I am going to add my fries back in and this
time you can see they are bubbling up immediately.

These are going to take absolutely no time
at all, they are going to take a matter of
just a minute or so.

They are going to get a beautiful dark golden
brown color and then I am going to take them

out onto the paper towel again and do my second
batch and I will show you what they look like
when they are done.
Season them as soon as they come out.
I just added my second batch.
Look at these!
Mmm.

I tell you, there is nothing quite like home
made French fries.

It is like that special thing, like the inside
of a watermelon, like the center slices of

a watermelon, it is like the juiciest thing
ever.

Home made French fries, there is nothing quite
like them.
Very hot!
So good!

Not that you need the written recipe but if
you want it go to LauraintheKitchen.com it
will be there waiting for you.

I am going to babysit these, serve them to
my quests.

I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me and I will see you next time.
Bye.
